description: Dive into "Capturing Jodhpur: A Journey Through Iconic Views" — a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Capturing Jodhpur: A Journey Through Iconic Views

places.generalDescription: Mehrangarh Fort, located in Jodhpur, is a magnificent hilltop fortress that provides stunning panoramic views of the city. The fort's architecture and intricate carvings showcase the grandeur and bravery of Jodhpur's royal family. Made of red sandstone, this structure stands as a testament to the rich heritage and cultural significance of the city, symbolizing its historical eminence.

sources.snippet: While other parts of the city do have a few blue facades the majority of the blue city is actually tucked in the neighborhood behind the Mehrangarh Fort. The old city is a maze and it is best to hire a local guide to take you around the blue buildings who can explain the history of the area to you and take you to the best terraces for incredible views of the blue rooftops with the Mehrangarh Fort looming in the background. One popular theory is that Jodhpur was painted blue to keep the homes cool in the extremely dry desert heat.
sources.shortName: The Ultimate Jodhpur Instagram Guide

sources.snippet: Situated atop a rocky hill, Mehrangarh Fort is one of Jodhpur’s iconic landmarks and an all-time photographer favorite. Boasting impressive walls, intricate architecture and panoramic city views below, its expansive walls and breathtaking architecture present photographers with endless photo opps; be it stunning gateways, intricate palaces or expansive courtyards: every part of Mehrangarh Fort provides photographers with photographic pleasure.
sources.shortName: Capturing Moments: Top Jodhpur Photo Places | by Rajwada Cab

sources.snippet: Perched on a rocky outcrop overlooking the city, Mehrangarh Fort provides panoramic views that are nothing short of breathtaking. The intricate carvings, expansive courtyards, and imposing walls make for an ideal subject, especially during the golden hours of sunrise and sunset when the fort and the city below are bathed in warm, ethereal light.
sources.shortName: 10 Photo Spots at Jodhpur

sources.snippet: Certainly, Mehrangarh posts the top of the remaining part in the rundown of "must visits" in jodhpur. What's more, why not, history of this post and style of engineering actually portrays the period of royals. Brilliant and noteworthy, this greatness in red sandstone is enclosed by a capricious delight.
sources.shortName: The Best Instagram-worthy Places in Jodhpur

sources.snippet: No questions about this, the Mehrangarh Fort tops the list of must visit places in the city of Jodhpur. The architecture of this Fort makes the viewer travel right back in history to the era of royals. Mehrangarh Fort is also one of the largest forts in India and it represents true Rajasthani-ness.
sources.shortName: 10 Instagrammable Photo Spots at Jodhpur

sources.snippet: Beyond question, Mehrangarh fort remains top in the list of “must visits” in jodhpur. And why not, history of this fort, and style of architecture still depicts the era of royals. Unbeatable and impressive, this grandeur in red sandstone is wrapped in an eccentric beauty.
sources.shortName: The Best Instagram-worthy Places in Jodhpur

sources.snippet: Must Read: Jodhpur’s Best Event Planners on which You can Trust. A sign of majesty and grandeur, Meharangarh Fort is atop a hill. This impressive piece of architecture is an ideal vicinity for photoshoots in Jodhpur.
sources.shortName: Top 15 Pre-wedding Shoot Locations In Jodhpur

sources.snippet: Mehrangarh fort is one of the largest forts in India, which makes it really special. Inside its boundaries, you can find several palaces. In my opinion, this place is very Instagrammable!
sources.shortName: 6 Best Instagram Photo Spots in Jodphur

sources.snippet: Known for majestic Mehrangarh fort, it has plenty of attractive places and palaces like Umaid Bhawan Palace, Jaswant Thada, Mandore Garden and Kaylana Lake.
sources.shortName: Jodhpur Photos - Jodhpur Photo Gallery Jodhpur Travel Images
30 Awesome Photos Of Jodhpur "The Blue City"
Your guide to photograph Jodhpur

places.name: Mehrangarh Fort

reviews.text: Really cool fort that dominates the skyline of Jodhpur!  Do a tour as you will get a tonne of details of the history and the cultural significance.  There are some wonderful architectural spaces in various parts of the Fort as well as museums and artwork that will teach you much of Hindu historical lore.  You can have a car drop you at the entrance or be brave and hike you way up and see the viewpoints along the way!!

This fort is so well kept. The Indian government should take a leaf out of the Maharajah's book as to how to curate a fort and preserve it cf Amber fort.
The gift shop isn't cheap but has lovely and immensely high quality gear with a huge range.
Huge number of domestic tourists asking for photos with us which is amusing for two people in their mid fifties but they were all jolly friendly.

It's a very beautiful fort and a big one. Very well maintained and preserved be advised that you have to walk a pretty steep incline to reach the fort entrance However there is a provision of lift at a cost of ₹50 . A must go to place to see a beautiful sunset. The downside is the ticket cost of ₹200 for indian nationals which is high and the counter closes at 5 PM

places.generalDescription: Mehrangarh Fort, dating back to around 1460, is one of India's largest forts. It offers lift access and galleries, guided tours, and shops for visitors. The best times to appreciate its architectural grandeur are at sunrise or sunset when the golden walls shimmer against the crimson sky. The fort stands tall at 400 feet amidst glittering blue homes and offers breathtaking panoramic views of Jodhpur. Additionally, it provides a chilling sense of history.

sources.snippet: Sitting atop a 400-feet-high hill, the beautiful Mehrangarh Fort commands the landscape of Jodhpur with its architectural brilliance and grandeur. The foundation stone of this majestic fort was laid by Rao Jodha in the mid-15 th century. Built over a period of 500 years, the fort bears testimony to the glorious era of the erstwhile ruling dynasty, and houses possibly the best museum in Rajasthan displaying paintings, arms and armoury, textiles, decorative arts and other prized exhibits.
sources.shortName: 12 Tourist Places to Visit in Jodhpur 2024: Timings, Entry Fee

sources.snippet: Mehrangarh, also known as Mehran Fort was built by Rao Jodha in 1459 in Jodhpur, is one of the largest forts in the country. It is situated at the top of a 410 feet elevated hill and guarded by massive walls. One of the most easily recognisable forts in Jodhpur, it has appeared in many Hollywood and Bollywood productions such as The Lion King, The Dark Knight Rises, and the more recent - Thugs of (Read More)Hindostan.
sources.shortName: 41 Best Places to visit in Jodhpur | Top Tourist Attractions

sources.snippet: While finding Pre Wedding Palace so Mehrangarh Fort and Umaid Bhawan Palace are some of the best pre-wedding locations in Jodhpur that convey majesty and wealth. Wear traditional or formal attire like Rajasthani traditional or formal, fine clothing, and use these amazing places for your picture session. Pose in front of the exquisite architecture and wide courtyards to exude royalty.
sources.shortName: 7 Best Pre Wedding Shoot Locations in Jodhpur 2025

sources.snippet: Imposing Mehrangarh Fort, which rises above the "Blue City," is one of the largest and most famous forts. It's an impressive, well-preserved heritage structure, and there's much to discover inside. The fort has been privately restored, and its museum has an outstanding display of royal memorabilia, including about 15,000 items from Maharaja Gaj Singh II's collection.
sources.shortName: Top 13 Things to Do in Jodhpur, Rajasthan

sources.snippet: Rising perpendicular and impregnable from a hill which is 125 metres above Jodhpur’s skyline is the Mehrangarh Fort. This historic fort is one of the most famous in India and is packed with history and legends. Mehrangarh Fort still bears the imprints of cannonball attacks courtesy the armies of Jaipur on its second gate.
sources.shortName: Best Places to Visit in Jodhpur, Attractions and Points of Interest- Rajasthan Tourism

sources.snippet: Highlight: Several festivals are held at Mehrangarh Fort, including Rajasthan International Folk Festival in October and World Sacred Spirit Festival in February, giving you a sneak peek about Rajasthani culture. Timings: 9 AM – 5 PM. Ticket Price: 100 INR (approx.) for Indians, 600 INR (approx.) for foreigners.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Attractions and Places to Visit in Jodhpur (UPDATED)

sources.snippet: Mehrangarh Fort is counted among the best Jodhpur tourist places. Majestic in every sense of the word, the fort has now been turned into a museum that reflects the rich cultural heritage of Jodhpur. Identified as one of the largest forts in the country, the museum accommodates several mahals within its premises.
sources.shortName: Tourist Places to Visit in Jodhpur (2021) in 2 Days

sources.snippet: I love all the blue houses you see from this viewpoint, and it is very nice that you can also see the Mehrangarh Fort from here!. This is one of the most photogenic places in Jodhpur that I found. View this post on Instagram
sources.shortName: 6 Best Instagram Photo Spots in Jodphur

sources.snippet: What’s Special – Mehrangarh Fort has now turned into a museum that depicts the rich culture and heritage of Jodhpur.
sources.shortName: 25 Best Places to Visit in Jodhpur Rajasthan
The Blue City, India

places.name: Mehrangarh Fort

reviews.text: Really cool fort that dominates the skyline of Jodhpur!  Do a tour as you will get a tonne of details of the history and the cultural significance.  There are some wonderful architectural spaces in various parts of the Fort as well as museums and artwork that will teach you much of Hindu historical lore.  You can have a car drop you at the entrance or be brave and hike you way up and see the viewpoints along the way!!

This fort is so well kept. The Indian government should take a leaf out of the Maharajah's book as to how to curate a fort and preserve it cf Amber fort.
The gift shop isn't cheap but has lovely and immensely high quality gear with a huge range.
Huge number of domestic tourists asking for photos with us which is amusing for two people in their mid fifties but they were all jolly friendly.

A Must-Visit: An amazing and fantastic fort located right in the city.
* Superbly Maintained: Kept in excellent condition by a dedicated staff of 300.
* Tourist-Friendly: Highly organized with the rare convenience of a lift for accessibility.
* Rich History: Offers a deep and immersive look into the past.
* Plan Your Visit: Allow at least 3 hours for a complete tour (a 9 AM thing to do)

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the heart of Jodhpur, Umaid Bhawan Palace stands as a testament to opulence and architectural brilliance. This stunning palace, constructed between 1928 and 1943 for Maharaja Umaid Singh, showcases Indo-Saracenic design with its grand yellow sandstone façade and sprawling gardens that cover an impressive 26 acres. Once built to provide employment during a drought, it now serves as both a luxurious hotel and museum, inviting travelers to immerse themselves in its rich history.

sources.snippet: What’s Special- Probably amongst the best places to explore in Jodhpur, Umaid Bhawan Palace will show you the glory of the city of Jodhpur. The architecture is the center of attraction. Interior of the palace looks gorgeous with Indo-Saracenic, Classical Revival and Western Art Deco styles which are designed in Makrana marble and Burmese teak wood.
sources.shortName: 25 Best Places to Visit in Jodhpur Rajasthan

sources.snippet: Umaid Bhawan Palace was built by Maharaja Umaid Singh in 1929 to counter a famine which had hit the state at the time. It was also known as the Chittar Palace while being constructed thanks to the use of stones drawn from the Chittar hill. The palace was designed by HV Lanchester, a renowned British architect, and was completed in 16 years.
sources.shortName: Best Places to Visit in Jodhpur, Attractions and Points of Interest- Rajasthan Tourism

sources.snippet: Magnificent Umaid Bhawan Palace, completed in 1944, was one of India's last grand palaces to be built. The royal family of Jodhpur still occupies a section of it. Most of the remainder has been converted into a luxurious palace hotel, and unfortunately, it's off-limits to anyone who's not staying there.
sources.shortName: Top 13 Things to Do in Jodhpur, Rajasthan

sources.snippet: Umaid Bhawan Palace | #3 of 12 Best Places to visit in Jodhpur. Your trip to Jodhpur would be incomplete without visiting the grand Umaid Bhawan Palace. Built in 1929 by Maharaja Umaid Singh, this palace is one of the largest private residences in the world.
sources.shortName: 12 Tourist Places to Visit in Jodhpur 2024: Timings, Entry Fee

places.name: Umaid Bhawan Palace, Jodhpur

reviews.text:
Amazing place to stay with kids. Lots of small gifts for the little ones. The staff is very generous and is helping you throughout the property. The food was delicious, from curries to home made ice creams; everything was perfect.
100% recommended.

"I'm still pinching myself after my stay at this Grand Hotel! From the moment I stepped into the lobby, I knew I was in for a treat. The staff were warm and welcoming, eager to make sure I had everything I needed. My room was spacious and beautifully subtle, with a comfy bed and stunning views of the city. But what really made my stay stand out was the attention to detail -, a complimentary bottle of wine, and a delicious breakfast spread that left me spoiled for choice. The hotel's location was perfect too. If you're looking for a comfortable, luxurious, and genuinely welcoming place to stay, look no further than the this palace. I'll be back for sure!"

Sometime a room becomes so subtle that it hangs on a threat to be called as boring.  Felt the need of air conditioning at certain places but since, it's a heritage property I understand that.  Morning, cold buffet was fine.  Overall, a good stay and there is everything for everyone.
The palace is located in a porsh area offering a great view of the city. It has a clock collection room, car collection and a canteen. It is recommended to visit. You will get an auto outside.

places.address: Circuit House Rd, near Umaid Bhawan Museum, Cantt Area, Jodhpur, Rajasthan 342006, India

places.generalDescription: Ghanta Ghar Jodhpur, also known as the Clock Tower, is a prominent landmark in the bustling Sardar Market. Built in 1911, it showcases stunning Rajput architecture and intricate carvings. The tower serves as a navigational point and symbol of Jodhpur's rich heritage.

sources.snippet: Yet another attraction included in the list of famous places to visit in Jodhpur, Ghanta Ghar is an essential landmark in the city which was built by Maharaja Sardar Singh during his rule. Your list of Jodhpur tourist places is incomplete without paying a visit to this tall colossal tower next to Sadar Bazar. You can choose to shop from the famous city market in proximity to the tower, try famous delicacies, or explore the regular life of the people of Jodhpur.
sources.shortName: Tourist Places to Visit in Jodhpur (2021) in 2 Days

sources.snippet: These vibrant streets around Ghanta Ghar and Sardar Market offer photographers endless photographic opportunities. From vibrant saris and turbans to busy vendors and shoppers, these lively markets present endless photo opportunities — especially at Ghanta Ghar itself with its bustling market square and vibrant city life!. It serves as an iconic focal point that captures Jodhpur city life perfectly!
sources.shortName: Capturing Moments: Top Jodhpur Photo Places | by Rajwada Cab

sources.snippet: At the heart of the old city, the iconic Ghanta Ghar stands as a prominent landmark, offering a rich tapestry of traditional architecture and vibrant street life. With its bustling surroundings, ornate detailing, and vibrant hues, this historic clock tower provides a captivating subject for street photography and architectural documentation.
sources.shortName: 10 Photo Spots at Jodhpur

sources.snippet: The Ghanta Ghar in Jodhpur is a magnificent clock tower in the centre of the city, built by Maharaja Sardar Singh about 200 years ago. Known as the clock tower of Rajasthan, it is a popular landmark that signifies the start of Old Jodhpur. The tower offers a brilliant panora (Read More)mic view of the city from the top.
sources.shortName: 41 Best Places to visit in Jodhpur | Top Tourist Attractions

sources.snippet:
Ghanta Ghar, also known as the clock tower, is situated in
one of the busiest areas of Jodhpur. The tower was built by
Maharaja Sardar singh from whom the adjacent Sardar
market takes its name. The Sadar Market is quite popular
among tourists for spices, traditional clothes and fancy
jewelry .
sources.shortName: Best Places to Visit in Jodhpur, Attractions and Points of Interest- Rajasthan Tourism

sources.snippet: Ghanta Ghar or Clock Tower market located on the new road is the most famous market in Jodhpur. If you are fond of local things, then coming here will be very beneficial for you. Spices, Rajasthani costumes, jewellery and handicrafts items will be available at this market at a good price.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Attractions and Places to Visit in Jodhpur (UPDATED)

places.name: Ghanta Ghar Jodhpur

reviews.text: The most hustling and bustling place in Jodhpur. Daytime you can dedicate for shopping from the tiny lanes dedicated for clothes, bangles and what not. In the midst of the lanes you would come across many savouries to devour.  Evening time you can stroll and look well lit clock tower and the fort presenting a great opportunity for photo enthusiasts. Standing near the clock tower you can imagine how well planned the cities would be in ancient times.

This historic clock tower was built in 1909 with a clock imported from London. It's located right in the center of Sardar Market and serves as a prominent landmark.

I've been visiting this area for over 10 years since my first trip, but unfortunately the dusty conditions remain unchanged. Every time a rickshaw passes by, clouds of dust still kick up from the unpaved roads, which can be quite uncomfortable.

While it's possible to enter the clock tower itself, I didn't find much merit in going inside, so I chose to skip visiting inside. The tower is impressive enough from the outside and worth seeing as part of exploring the bustling Sardar Market.

This monument built in the centre of the city, with tickets priced at 25/- per person is good to go. It provides good views of the mehergarh fort.

Historically it has been for hundreds of years, with the maintenance of the clock tower handed to a particular family down the generations.

Surrounding it is the sardar market, which is good for vegetables, spices, local handicrafts and general grocery items.

places.address: 72Vf Fjm 2nd LINE, 2ND LINE NEAR GHANTAGHAR, Jodhpur, Rajasthan 342001, India

places.generalDescription: Jaswant Thada is an exquisite white marble memorial built in 1899 to honor Maharaja Jaswant Singh II, serving as the cremation ground for the royal family of Jodhpur. This architectural marvel, resembling a glowing structure when illuminated by sunlight, is located just 1km northeast of Mehrangarh Fort.

sources.snippet: Considered one of the most beautifully designed architectural landmarks of Jodhpur, Jaswant Thada is a well-equipped tourist destination to include in your Jodhpur tour package. Located next to the Mehrangarh Fort, the place is known for being an artistic wonder in the city that was built by Maharaja Sardar Singh of Jodhpur in the memory of his father Maharaja Jaswant Singh. Today, the site serves as a cremation ground for the royal Rajput families of Marwar.
sources.shortName: Tourist Places to Visit in Jodhpur (2021) in 2 Days

sources.snippet: Another brilliant example of India’s architectural wonders, Jaswant Thada sits beside a lake just a little away from the Mehrangarh Fort. This white marble monument, built in the 19 th century, commemorates the memory of Maharaja Jaswant Singh II who once ruled the city. You must visit this place in Jodhpur for its enchanting beauty, peaceful surroundings, scenic vistas, and for its extensive collection of paintings and portraits of Jodhpur rulers.
sources.shortName: 12 Tourist Places to Visit in Jodhpur 2024: Timings, Entry Fee

sources.snippet: Situated near Mehrangarh Fort, Jaswant Thada is a stunning marble cenotaph built to honor Maharaja Jaswant Singh II and set among serene gardens overlooking an inviting lake — making for an idyllic photo location!. From taking shots of its intricate carvings and delicate lattice work to simply photographing its peaceful surroundings — Jaswant Thada makes for the ideal setting to capture memorable photographs!
sources.shortName: Capturing Moments: Top Jodhpur Photo Places | by Rajwada Cab

sources.snippet: This intricately crafted cenotaph (empty commemorative tomb) was built in 1899 In honor of Maharaja Jaswant Singh II. It features white marble lattice screens and whimsical domes, while the inside is adorned with portraits of Rathore rulers. It's a peaceful place to relax and enjoy stunning views of the Fort and city. Many a tired tourist sprawls on the front lawn to recuperate after sightseeing.
sources.shortName: Top 13 Things to Do in Jodhpur, Rajasthan

sources.snippet: Jaswant Thada is a cenotaph that was built hundreds of years back in 1899. Back then, it would serve as a cremation ground for the royal family of Marwar, and now its grandeur and architecture attract locals and tourists alike. However, it is still not as popular as other spots on the list, which fortunately makes it not only a perfect instagrammable spot but also a peaceful spot.
sources.shortName: 10 Instagrammable Photo Spots at Jodhpur

sources.snippet: From the old town, it is a beautiful up-hill walk or quick rickshaw ride to the spectacular Jaswant Thada mausoleum. The white marble funerary monument was erected in the late 1800s to honor Maharaja Jaswant Singh II and was used as the cremation grounds for the royal Marwar family. Intricately carved inlays, known as jalis, are what make the structure so spectacular.
sources.shortName: The Ultimate Jodhpur Instagram Guide

sources.snippet: This milky white memorial built towards the end of the 19th century as a tribute to the leader Jaswant Singh is a huge tourist attraction. Jaswant Singh, who ruled Jodhpur, invested well in his state. He made attempts to bring down the level of crime, subdue dacoits, built railways and broadly worked on raising the economy of Marwar.
sources.shortName: Best Places to Visit in Jodhpur, Attractions and Points of Interest- Rajasthan Tourism

sources.snippet: This structure is just a few minutes downhill walk from the main fort, so there is no need to take a ride. Also called "Taj Mahal of Marwar", it was built in the honour and memory of Maharaja Jaswant Singh II and is still used by the Marwar Royal Family as cremation grounds.
sources.shortName: 41 Best Places to visit in Jodhpur | Top Tourist Attractions

sources.snippet: The beautiful White Marble structure is a brilliant example of traditional Rajasthani architecture style. Story and Interesting Facts. Reckoned to be one of the top architectural landmarks in Jodhpur, Jaswant Thada is located a short distance from the mighty Mehrangarh Fort.
sources.shortName: 25 Best Places to Visit in Jodhpur Rajasthan

sources.snippet: An architectural wonder, Jaswant Thanda ensembles the history of Jodhpur and Mughal Monuments. Close to Merangarh Castle, this place looks elegant, with white marble depicting peace and charm. Its intricate carvings and serene surroundings act as a picture-perfect backdrop.
sources.shortName: Top 15 Pre-wedding Shoot Locations In Jodhpur

sources.snippet: Jaswant Thada is a cenotaph built in 1899, which serves as the cremation ground for the royal family of Marwar. The color of the building is very pretty, and especially when it isn't very crowded, you can make some wonderful photos here. View this post on Instagram
sources.shortName: 6 Best Instagram Photo Spots in Jodphur

sources.snippet: They say “The Taj Mahal of Mewar” , carvings of this monument are beautifully intricate. Standing adjacent to Mehrangarh Fort, this is a cluster of majestic cenotaphs in white marble. while the inside is adorned with portraits of Rathore rulers.
sources.shortName: The Best Instagram-worthy Places in Jodhpur

sources.snippet: They say "The Taj Mahal of Mewar", carvings of this landmark are wonderfully multifaceted. Standing nearby Mehrangarh Fort, this is a group of grand cenotaphs in white marble. while within is decorated with representations of Rathore rulers.
sources.shortName: The Best Instagram-worthy Places in Jodhpur

sources.snippet: Highlights: Jaswant Thada is known as the Taj Mahal of Rajasthan because it is entirely built with white marble and lovely domes. Timings: 9 AM – 6 PM. Ticket Price: 30 INR (approx.) for Indians, 50 INR (approx.) for foreigners.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Attractions and Places to Visit in Jodhpur (UPDATED)

sources.snippet: Next to Mehrangarh Fort is Jaswant Thada, a tranquil marble cenotaph. All around it are gorgeous gardens. Its bright white building contrasts with Jodhpur's blue skyline.
sources.shortName: 7 Best Pre Wedding Shoot Locations in Jodhpur 2025

sources.snippet: Known for majestic Mehrangarh fort, it has plenty of attractive places and palaces like Umaid Bhawan Palace, Jaswant Thada, Mandore Garden and Kaylana Lake.
sources.shortName: Jodhpur Photos - Jodhpur Photo Gallery Jodhpur Travel Images
10 Photo Spots at Jodhpur

places.name: Jaswant Thada

reviews.text:
"The Taj Mahal of Rajasthan"

Just spent 50₹ on tickets and experience the architectural beauty of Marwar. Sculptured in marble with love will make you wonder. Beautiful garden in the surroundings and the monument is fascinating. It's good place and near to Mehrangarh fort but did not find much here to explore. Be careful when visiting this place as ola and uber cabs deny to visit here or they may try to force you to pay more than showing in app.

Best place to visit after Mehrangarh Fort.
Just nearby the fort and only walking distance.

Made in memory of Maharaja Jaswant Singh, the white-marble building is minutes from Mehrangarh Fort, and depicts lovely sculptures, beautiful domes and a striking peacock memorial.Jaswant Thada is highly praised for its stunning architecture and serene atmosphere, often referred to as the 'Taj Mahal of Marwar.' Visitors appreciate the beautiful white marble structure, well-maintained gardens, and breathtaking views of Mehrangarh Fort and the surrounding landscape. The site is ideal for photography and peaceful reflection, making it a must-visit for history lovers and families.
1.The memorial remains open from 9 a.m. -5 p.m.
2. Arrive early morning to avoid the crowd and the afternoon heat, and early evening if you want to see the sunset.
Why is it Famous?
•
Architectural landmark
•
Stunning views of Mehrangarh Fort
•
Known as the 'Taj Mahal of Marwar'
•
Intricate marble carvings that glow in sunlight
•
Cremation ground for the royal family of Marwar
•
Hosts Sufiana music revelry, attracting musicians from around the world

As far as i know this place is also known as Taj mahal of Jodhpur. If you are visiting Mehrangarh fort, you can include this also in iternary.

This place closes at 5pm so plan accordingly. View from this place is good and you can see the city from here.

places.generalDescription: Umaid Bhawan Palace, a historic structure renovated into a hotel in 1977, offers an authentic royal experience. Nestled amidst lush greenery, it provides a warm welcome and excellent service. Guests rave about the beautiful palace art and describe it as a heavenly place to stay. If you've ever dreamt of living like royalty, this is a must-visit destination with top-notch food and prompt service.

sources.snippet: Umaid Bhawan Palace, one of the world’s largest private residences, is an architectural masterpiece that exudes grandeur and opulence. From its grand exterior and lush gardens to ornate interiors and its splendid interior designs — Umaid Bhawan Palace serves as an incredible photographic backdrop. Photographers may capture its majestic exterior or explore its exquisite interiors or stroll its sprawling gardens for unforgettable photos to commemorate Jodhpur’s royal history.
sources.shortName: Capturing Moments: Top Jodhpur Photo Places | by Rajwada Cab

sources.snippet: One of the last constructed palaces in India, Umaid Bhawan is known for its design and architecture from the historic era, making it bag a place among the famous Jodhpur attractions. Located within the city premises, the palace takes you back to the princely era of Jodhpur with its spellbinding construction. It is divided into three areas, one of which is still owned by the royal family while the rest two are converted into a heritage hotel and museum, respectively.
sources.shortName: Tourist Places to Visit in Jodhpur (2021) in 2 Days

sources.snippet: Need to catch the extravagance side of Jodhpur city, Head directly to Umaid Bhavan Palace. The Umaid Bhawan Palace is one of those notable royal residences that was implicit the year 1928 – 1943. This is a castle that is for the most part accepted to be worked with fabulous yellow sandstone spreading more than 26 sections of land of the nursery.
sources.shortName: The Best Instagram-worthy Places in Jodhpur

sources.snippet: Want to capture the luxury side of Jodhpur city, Head straight to Umaid Bhavan Palace. The Umaid Bhawan Palace is one of those well-known palaces that was built in the year 1928 – 1943. This is a palace that is generally believed to be built with grand yellow sandstone spreading over 26 acres of garden.
sources.shortName: The Best Instagram-worthy Places in Jodhpur

sources.snippet: A symbol of regal grandeur, the Umaid Bhawan Palace with its majestic architecture, lush gardens, and opulent interiors presents a regal canvas for photography. Whether it's capturing its imposing façade or the elegant details of its interiors, this palace promises a visual feast for your lens.
sources.shortName: 10 Photo Spots at Jodhpur

sources.snippet: Read More: Best Hotels for Destination Weddings in Ahmedabad. Umaid Bhawan Palace, one of the most captivating sights with lush gardens and rich heritage, is one of the perfect pre-wedding shoot locations in Jodhpur. Perched atop a hill, the palace offers breathtaking views of the city.
sources.shortName: Top 15 Pre-wedding Shoot Locations In Jodhpur

sources.snippet: If you want to take a break from all the crowded tourist-y places and fall into luxury’s lap, Umaid Bhawan Palace is the place for you!. The newest construction on the list, the Palace was built in 1928. Built with yellow sandstone, it spreads over 26 acres.
sources.shortName: 10 Instagrammable Photo Spots at Jodhpur

sources.snippet: The ultimate in luxury in Jodhpur, the Umaid Bhawan Palace is actually a palace and the hotel is one part of it, owned by the Taj Hotel Group. It’s around $700 per night and higher in the peak season (Dec/Jan). Check availability here.

sources.snippet: Highlights: Umaid Bhawan is the last royal palace built in India before Independence. It is one of the best heritage hotels for a destination wedding in India. Venue Options: 4 indoor and 6 outdoor

places.name: Umaid Bhawan Palace, Jodhpur

reviews.text:
Amazing place to stay with kids. Lots of small gifts for the little ones. The staff is very generous and is helping you throughout the property. The food was delicious, from curries to home made ice creams; everything was perfect.
100% recommended.

It  is a stunning blend of heritage and luxury. One of the world's largest private residences, it is divided into a luxury hotel (Taj), a museum, and the royal family's home.

- Architecture: Built in golden sandstone, the palace showcases Indo-Art Deco style with grand courtyards, exquisite murals, and vintage decor.
- Luxury Stay:The Taj-operated hotel offers opulent rooms, impeccable service, and world-class amenities, including a spa and fine dining.
- Museum: Displays artifacts, clocks, and vintage cars, offering a glimpse into Jodhpur's royal history.
- Views & Grounds: Breathtaking views of the Blue City and Mehrangarh Fort, along with lush gardens and a picturesque pool.
Expensive but worth it !!!

"I'm still pinching myself after my stay at this Grand Hotel! From the moment I stepped into the lobby, I knew I was in for a treat. The staff were warm and welcoming, eager to make sure I had everything I needed. My room was spacious and beautifully subtle, with a comfy bed and stunning views of the city. But what really made my stay stand out was the attention to detail -, a complimentary bottle of wine, and a delicious breakfast spread that left me spoiled for choice. The hotel's location was perfect too. If you're looking for a comfortable, luxurious, and genuinely welcoming place to stay, look no further than the this palace. I'll be back for sure!"

Sometime a room becomes so subtle that it hangs on a threat to be called as boring.  Felt the need of air conditioning at certain places but since, it's a heritage property I understand that.  Morning, cold buffet was fine.  Overall, a good stay and there is everything for everyone.

places.generalDescription: Gangshyam Temple in Jodhpur is a stunning 16th-century temple that offers a visual treat with its green and gold hues. The friendly priests welcome visitors to explore the temple, which is dedicated to Lord Krishna. The serene and spiritual atmosphere, adorned with ancient hand-painted paintings, attracts people from all over India and the world. Visitors can experience the unique prasad of paan beeda offered by the priest.

sources.snippet: Green and gold, this 16th century temple is exactly what your Instagram feed needs. As the most beautiful temple in Jodhpur, it is truly a feast for your eyes. If you wish to take a look inside, you will find the most friendly priests.

places.name: Ghanshyam Temple Jodhpur Gangshyam Ji

reviews.text: Stepping into Gangshyam Temple in Jodhpur was an enchanting experience that left a lasting impression on my spiritual journey. The temple, dedicated to Lord Krishna, exudes a captivating blend of vibrant aesthetics, intricate carvings, and a deeply devotional atmosphere. The architectural brilliance of the temple is evident in the delicate craftsmanship adorning its walls, reflecting the rich cultural heritage of Rajasthan. The vibrant colors and detailed sculptures transport visitors to a realm of divine beauty and artistic expression. Nestled in the heart of Jodhpur, Gangshyam Temple stands as a testament to the city's religious and cultural tapestry. It's not merely a place of worship but a haven where history, art, and spirituality converge seamlessly. I highly recommend a visit to Gangshyam Temple for a soul-enriching experience in the embrace of divine tranquility.
Ghanshyam temple is one of the oldest temple of Old city of Jodhpur Rajasthan. It has a very old medeival age deity of Lord Krishna as Ghanshyam Ji Maharaj. Very peaceful and religious temple.

Awesom temple.. the outer court is beautiful and the inner temple court is just a brilliant work of art. As soon as you step foot the peace and spiritual vibes are just felt by the soul.... The most unique features is the temple walls and the roof... Each art is a work of genius. Each wall depicts a story ... Paintings on the roof and the walls will just capture your heart. The arti is just next level... Must visit if you have come to jodhpur....
Beautiful and spiritual place...

places.generalDescription: Shree Chamunda Mata Temple, located on the southern edge of Jodhpur's landmark fort, is a popular Hindu temple with stunning views of the city. The temple houses a black stone idol of Mother Chamunda and is known for its serene atmosphere, except during festival days when it becomes lively. Nestled within the vibrant city, this divine sanctuary offers visitors a spiritual journey and an immersive experience in its tranquil and devotional ambiance.

sources.snippet: Located at the end of Mehrangarh Fort, Chamunda Mata Temple is among the oldest and most revered temples in Jodhpur. The Goddess is considered the main deity of the inhabitants of Jodhpur and is regarded as the 'Isht Devi' or foremost goddess of the royal family. This holy temple attracts a lot of devotees and worshippers, especially during festivals of Dussehra and Navratri, and is considered a p (Read More)ilgrimage site among many Hindus.
sources.shortName: 41 Best Places to visit in Jodhpur | Top Tourist Attractions

sources.snippet: Chamunda Mata Temple | #8 of 12 Best Places to visit in Jodhpur. Located on the southern edge of Jodhpur’s landmark fort, Chamunda Mata Temple is one of the most popular places of worship in the city. In its sanctum sanctorum is a black stone idol of Mother Chamunda, which was brought here from Mandore in 1460 by Rao Jodha.

places.name: Shree Chamunda Mata Temple

reviews.text: This temple is situated inside the mehrangad fortress. One will have to walk all the way to this end point of the fort. This is the only temple in the premises of Mehrangad and the royal family used to offer puja here. There is a separate route for females and kids to go to this temple and a stairway to this temple for the men. Since we went to this temple during the sunset we witnessed a beautiful and mesmerizing sunset here. A note to the elderly, kindly take the elevator to the top of the fort and take a walk around as it is a huge place to walk and cover.

The Temple is inside the Mehrangarh Fort. The scenic and serene beauty in and around the temple surpasses the beauty of the fort! Interacting with the Pandit Ji (Tiwari Ji) doing puja there would also be a memorable experience as he may tell you the brief history of the temple.

Chamunda Mata Temple is a peaceful and spiritually uplifting place nestled within Mehrangarh Fort. The temple itself is small but holds deep historical and religious significance for the locals. What truly makes this spot special is the breathtaking bird's-eye view of Jodhpur's iconic blue houses-an unforgettable sight!

The atmosphere is serene, with a cool breeze and fewer crowds compared to other parts of the fort. It's a perfect place to pause, soak in the beauty of the Blue City, and experience a moment of tranquility.

places.address: mehron ko bass, Gulab Sagar, Jodhpur, Rajasthan 342001, India

places.generalDescription: Mandore Garden, located just a short drive from Jodhpur, is a picturesque and historically rich site. The garden features tomblike monuments, temples, statues, and the ruins of Mandore. It holds an illustrious past with intricate cenotaphs and sprawling lawns adorned with vibrant flower beds. The region has a centuries-old history of sandstone mining evident in its architectonic monuments like Jodhpur Palace and Meharangarh Fort.

sources.snippet: Mandore served as the capital of the erstwhile kingdom of Marwar, until it was abandoned in 1459 CE. However, Mandore Gardens have fought the trials of time and still stand strong to tell the tales of the town’s glorious past. An ideal place to click Instagram-worthy photos, this garden houses an ancient temple, cenotaphs of Maharajas of Jodhpur, a Hall of Heroes and a government museum; all depicting the rich cultural heritage of the princely state.
sources.shortName: 12 Tourist Places to Visit in Jodhpur 2024: Timings, Entry Fee

Mandore is a small town about 9 km away from Jodhpur.

The garden also has a Government Museum, which is full of artefacts and old relics.

places.name: Mandore Garden

reviews.text: Mandore Garden is truly one of the hidden gem of Jodhpur. This garden is is big and have lots of things to do within the premises. They have a toy train service to transport one to the other end of the mandore. The garden premises consists of Cenotaphs, temples, museum, palace, recreation place, large mughal style water fountain and few amenities to cater to the tourists. The entrance fee per person is 40 bucks. The toilets can be much better in cleanliness. The museum inside has a separate entry fee of 20 bucks per head. Overall it will take around 2 to 3 hrs to explore this garden if one is a lover of art and architecture. This place even has a light and sound show in the evening for which one will have to pre book. This is situated at an outskirts of Jodhpur so one will really have to insist the driver to take there. Highly recommended!

It was a total surprise. Thought it was just another garden. Till we reach and realize it's a slice of history. Beautifully maintained gardens, unbelievably sculpted temples and fort.

Museum maintenance was a bit low. Should be improved.

Must visit when in Jodhpur.

This place is must to be added in your iternary if you are visiting Jodhpur.

Things to take care of
1. Try visiting in evening, you will enjoy the light show happening 8:00-8:30pm and take your tickets accordingly for this
2. If you are buying anything to eat from this place, pay at the time you ask for it, if you finish and later ask for price, they will ask for double rate and you will have no choice.

places.generalDescription: Kaylana Lake, an artificial lake in Jodhpur, was constructed in the 19th century by Raja Pratap Singh. Covering 84 square kilometers, it is surrounded by igneous rock formations and is fed by the Elephant Canal connected to the Indira Gandhi Canal. The area boasts natural vegetation including acacia trees and Siberian crane plants, making it a haven for migratory birds during winter.

sources.snippet: Kaylana Lake is an artificial lake spread across an 82 km square stretch in the west of Jodhpur city while also making its way to Jaisalmer. It was built by Pratap Singh in the year 1872 to serve as a source of drinking water for the locals of Jodhpur. Besides that, the site is famous among the travellers for trekking, hill climbing, camping and several religious sites in its proximity.

sources.snippet: Nestled amidst scenic landscapes, the lake offers a picturesque setting for a nature-themed pre-wedding photoshoot. Far from the hustle and bustle of the town, the lake sits in the lap of the Aravalli ranges. The lake's reposeful water lies between lush greenery and undulating hills, offering a romantic photoshoot setting.

places.name: Kaylana Lake

reviews.text: Good for refreshment with friends and family on the outskirts of jodhpur. Camels ride, boating and zip lining are also available for refreshment.

Kaylana Lake, a serene man‑made oasis just 8 km west of Jodhpur, was built in 1872 by Maharaja Pratap Singh to alleviate water scarcity  . Covering about 0.84 km² and reaching depths of 35–50 ft, it sits nestled among rugged rock formations and babool trees, creating a striking contrast against the desert backdrop  .

Visitors often praise the lake for its peaceful ambiance and natural beauty. In winter (October–March), it transforms into a paradise for bird watchers, welcoming migratory species like Siberian cranes, pelicans, herons, and flamingos  . Early mornings and evenings offer the best light, turning the water into a reflective canvas at sunrise and sunset  .

Recreational options are plentiful-boating is popular, with paddle, motor, and speed boats available (from around ₹120–₹250)  . Nature walks, trekking to a nearby Shiv Mandir, cycling, and picnicking by the shore add to the charm  .

Despite its appeal, amenities are sparse. Visitors note limited facilities-restrooms can be locked or inaccessible, and there's a shortage of food stalls  . So pack essentials like water and snacks. Entry is free, and the lake is accessible daily, best enjoyed from 9 AM to 5 PM  .

Overall, Kaylana Lake is a peaceful retreat-ideal for a 2–3‑hour stop. It's especially lovely during winter and monsoon when migratory birds take centre stage. Just don't expect luxury-come for the calm, wildlife sightings, and scenic views of Jodhpur's desert landscape.

History -Kaylana Lake is located 8 km west of Jodhpur in Rajasthan, India. It is an artificial lake, built by Pratap Singh in 1872.
In ancient times this region had palaces and gardens made by two rulers of Jodhpur - Bhim Singh and Takhat Singh. These were destroyed to make Kaylana Lake.
Present - Very scenic and calm place specially if you are a sunset lover. Perfect for calm evening near lakeside with beautiful sunset views and boating.
Few camel rides are also available with some evening snacks to munch on. Welcome maintained these days.

Perfect place for a photo shoot specially your pre wedding shoot as the ambience is breathtaking specially during the sunset.

Must visit once.

places.generalDescription: The Sheesh Palace is an attraction located within the expansive Mehrangarh fortress, perched on a hilltop and built during the 15th century. The palace boasts a multitude of decorative mirrors that adorn its walls, creating an enchanting visual experience for visitors. This museum offers a unique glimpse into the history and architecture of ancient India while also showcasing intricate artwork and design elements.

sources.snippet: The Sheesh Mahal in the Mehrangarh Fort of Jodhpur, known as the Glass Palace of Jodhpur, is a marvellous piece of historic architecture is decked from ceiling to floor with fanciful mirror work. The ceilings and floors are inlaid with mirrors, earning the room the title of Hall of Mirrors. It is said to be the bedchamber of Maharaja Ajit Singh between the 17th and 18th centuries.
sources.shortName: 41 Best Places to visit in Jodhpur | Top Tourist Attractions

places.name: Sheesh Mahal

reviews.text: The Sheesh Mahal, or "Glass Palace," is a captivating chamber within Jodhpur's Mehrangarh Fort, exemplifying the opulence of royal Rajput architecture. This hall is adorned from floor to ceiling with intricate mirror work, creating a dazzling effect that enchants visitors.

The Sheesh Mahal (Hall of Mirrors) in Mehrangarh Fort, Jodhpur, Rajasthan, is an incredibly beautiful and opulent chamber. It stands as a prime example of Rajput architecture and grandeur.
Constructed during the reign of Maharaja Ajit Singh (1678-1724), this room is adorned with shimmering mirrors and colored glass pieces. The walls and ceilings are covered in intricate patterns and designs that glisten in the light. These mirrors were strategically placed to reflect both natural and artificial light (such as oil lamps), illuminating the entire room and creating a magical and expansive effect. Even the ceilings feature mirrors that give the illusion of a starry night. This palace symbolizes the royal lifestyle and the artistic excellence of the Rajput rulers.

One of the most beautiful and most and most visited palace in Mehrangarh Fort which houses several palaces, one of them is Kanch Mahal known for its stunning stained glass windows that depict various religious motifs and figures. The palace is a unique blend of Rajput and Mughal architectural styles and is a testament to the artistic prowess of the craftsmen of that era.

places.address: 72X9+MQR, Mehrangarh Ft Rd, Sodagaran Mohalla, Jodhpur, Rajasthan 342001, India

places.generalDescription: Phool Mahal Palace, an integral part of Mehrangarh Fort, is a lavishly decorated hall that once served as a pleasure dome for the Maharajas. Built in the 18th century by Maharaja Abhay Singh, it features intricate gold filigree work, stained glass windows, and vibrant murals. The hall's design reflects its name with delicate gold filigree work resembling a blossoming flower.

sources.snippet: The Phool Mahal, or palace of flowers, is the most lavish hall present in the Mehrangarh Fort. Built by Maharaja Abhaya Singh in the 18th century, it was the site where he would be entertained by female dancers. It is less easily accessible as compared to the other rooms of the fort, indicating the private use and exclusivity of this room.
sources.shortName: 41 Best Places to visit in Jodhpur | Top Tourist Attractions

sources.snippet: Going by the name, the Phool Mahal or Flower Hall is the most exorbitant of all the halls in the palace. This beautiful chamber is said to be the pleasure dome for the Maharajas. The gold used for constructing the Mahal came from Ahmedabad, Gujarat.
sources.shortName: Best Places to Visit in Jodhpur, Attractions and Points of Interest- Rajasthan Tourism

places.name: Phool Mahal Palace

reviews.text:
The Mehrangarh Fort is one of the largest forts in the country and is known for its architectural beauty and historical significance. The fort houses several palaces, each with its own unique features and history.
Phool Mahal is an exquisite palace known for its intricate gold filigree work, paintings, and mirror work. It was created as a pleasure dome by Maharaja Abhaya Singh and was used for entertainment and festivities.

**A Majestic Marvel in the Blue City**

Mehrangarh Fort, towering 400 feet above Jodhpur, is not just a historical monument but a breathtaking symbol of Rajasthan's grandeur. Built in the 15th century by Rao Jodha, the fort's imposing walls and intricate architecture leave visitors spellbound.

### **Highlights:**
- **Architecture & Views:** The fort's massive gates, ornate palaces (like Moti Mahal and Phool Mahal), and expansive courtyards showcase Rajput craftsmanship. The panoramic views of Jodhpur's blue houses from the ramparts are unforgettable.
- **Museum:** One of the best in Rajasthan, it houses an exquisite collection of palanquins, arms, costumes, and royal artifacts. The audio guide (narrated by Shah Rukh Khan) adds a fascinating touch.
- **Cultural Experience:** Live folk music performances and the famous "Jodhpur RIFF" festival make the fort come alive with Rajasthani culture.
- **Chokelao Bagh & Café:** A serene garden and rooftop café offering delicious local snacks with a stunning fort backdrop.

### **Tips:**
- Visit early morning or late afternoon to avoid crowds and heat.
- Don't miss the "Chamunda Devi Temple" and the thrilling "Jayapol" victory gate.
- Photography enthusiasts will love the endless photo opportunities.

**** Mehrangarh Fort is a must-visit for history buffs, architecture lovers, and anyone seeking a glimpse into Rajasthan's royal past. Its sheer scale, beauty, and cultural richness make it one of India's finest forts.

**** A mesmerizing journey through time-highly recommended!

The Phool Mahal, or "Palace of Flowers," is one of the most exquisitely decorated and historically significant chambers within the Mehrangarh Fort in Jodhpur, Rajasthan.
Built in the 18th century by Maharaja Abhaya Singh, it served as a private audience hall and a space for royal entertainment and leisure. The name "Phool Mahal" itself suggests its vibrant beauty, as its interiors are designed to evoke the essence of a blooming flower.
Here's what makes it so remarkable:
* Opulent Decor: The palace is renowned for its extravagant decoration, featuring intricate frescoes, elaborate carvings, and richly colored wall paintings. The walls and ceilings are adorned with gold leaf work, often using gold brought from Gujarat, creating a lavish and regal ambiance.
* Artistic Excellence: You'll find a stunning display of Rajput and Mughal artistry, including detailed mirror work, delicate filigree, and vivid murals depicting royal life, traditional motifs, and even illustrations from the famous Raga Mala series (Indian classical music compositions). Portraits of Jodhpur's ancestors also grace the walls.
* Exclusive Use: Unlike some other parts of the fort, Phool Mahal was a private and exclusive chamber, primarily used by the Maharaja for private gatherings, entertainment by female dancers, and as a personal retreat. This exclusivity is reflected in its less accessible location within the fort.
* Historical Significance: It stands as a testament to the grandeur and artistic patronage of the Rathore rulers of Jodhpur, offering a glimpse into the lavish lifestyle of the royal family.
Today, Phool Mahal is a key part of the Mehrangarh Fort museum, allowing visitors to step back in time and admire its unique blend of architectural beauty and artistic splendor.

places.address: 72X9+HMC, Fort Entrance Rd, Sodagaran Mohalla, Jodhpur, Rajasthan 342001, India

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the heart of Jodhpur's Old City, Toorji Ka Jhalra Bavdi is a beautifully restored 18th-century stepwell adorned with exquisite sandstone carvings. This ancient marvel offers a captivating challenge for photographers, with its intricate designs, arched niches, and symmetrical patterns providing an ideal backdrop for capturing stunning images.

sources.snippet: Tucked away in Jodhpur’s Old City lies Toorji Ka Jhalra — an ancient stepwell that offers photographers an exciting photographic challenge. Featuring intricate carvings, arched niches, and symmetrical patterns for photographers to enjoy photographing, Toorji Ka Jhalra provides photographers with an ideal setting to explore history through beauty — be it shadow and light play on its walls, reflections in its waters or simply enjoying its breathtaking architecture — Toorji Ka Jhalra offers photographers something truly special in terms of history and beauty for photography enthusiasts alike!
sources.shortName: Capturing Moments: Top Jodhpur Photo Places | by Rajwada Cab

sources.snippet: Constructed in 1740, Toorji Ka Jhalra, commonly called stepwell of Jodhpur, is an intricate design of stepwell, one of the few remaining structures depicting the traditional water management systems of Jodhpur. This architectural wonder was built by the queen-consort of Maharaja Abhaya Singh, a sign of the age-old tradition of the region where royal women were in charge of overseeing the public wa (Read More)ter works.
sources.shortName: 41 Best Places to visit in Jodhpur | Top Tourist Attractions

sources.snippet: Toorji ka Jhalra is a famous stepwell built by Maharaja Abhay Singh’s consort in the 1740s. The site is well known for its fabulous architecture from ancient times and serves as a celebration spot for women of Jodhpur during the Gangaur pooja. Beyond its architecture and design, the site showcases a traditional system of water management in the city, making it one of the best places to see in Jodhpur.
sources.shortName: Tourist Places to Visit in Jodhpur (2021) in 2 Days

sources.snippet: A secret diamond in Jodhpur, Toorji ka Jhalra is as yet unclear to numerous vacationers heading out to jodhpur. The legend says that the stepwell was worked by a sovereign, associate of Maharaja Abhaya Singh in 1740. Toorji Ka Jhalra is only a couple hundred meters from the Clock Tower in Jodhpur, the progression well actually is by all accounts generally off the traveler map.
sources.shortName: The Best Instagram-worthy Places in Jodhpur

sources.snippet: A hidden gem in Jodhpur, Toorji ka Jhalra is still unknown to many tourists travelling to jodhpur. The legend says that the stepwell was built by a queen, consort of Maharaja Abhaya Singh in 1740. Toorji Ka Jhalra is just a few hundred meters from the Clock Tower in Jodhpur, the step well still seems to be largely off the tourist map.
sources.shortName: The Best Instagram-worthy Places in Jodhpur

sources.snippet: As seen many times in movies, the historic 18th-century stepwell is captivating with sandstone carvings. The place is inspired by Rajput architecture, which makes it an ideal destination for pre-wedding photography. Its deep stairs and historic walls act as an alluring backdrop.
sources.shortName: Top 15 Pre-wedding Shoot Locations In Jodhpur

sources.snippet: If you want to dig into the history of Jodhpur, explore this fabulous architecture of the 18th century. Toorji Ka Jhalra Bavdi is a stepwell that features intricate sandstone carvings. It is basically a stepwell where the famous Gangaur festival is celebrated.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Attractions and Places to Visit in Jodhpur (UPDATED)

sources.snippet: Toorji ka Jhalra is a stepwell that, according to legend, was constructed by a queen during 1740. This spot is amazing for getting clicked as the geometric design on the stairs. And the deep blue water frame and magnificent capture.
sources.shortName: 10 Instagrammable Photo Spots at Jodhpur

sources.snippet: Built in the 1740s and called Toorji ka Jhalra, it sat stagnant for years, until they purified the pool and sandblasted the steps. The area around it has been turned into a contemporary square with cool cafes and shops.
sources.shortName: Your guide to photograph Jodhpur

sources.snippet: The different levels on which you can stand here are really cool!. Also, the blue water looks very beautiful and will give your feed a little more color, which is always nice. View this post on Instagram
sources.shortName: 6 Best Instagram Photo Spots in Jodphur
25 Best Places to Visit in Jodhpur Rajasthan
10 Photo Spots at Jodhpur

places.name: Toorji Ka Jhalra Bavdi

reviews.text: This place is just in front of a hotel with all the foreign tourists who stay. This place is so beautiful as it has just taken from a movie shot. I liked the quiet feel amidst the crowd here. There were places to sit in the shade in the sun too which was the best part overall. The lake water too isn't untouched and looks clean. You cannot go enar the water as there are guards watching.

Very good place. No tickets are required. It's located in an open, but busy and narrow street. I encountered a significant crowd during my visit. This is a stepwell from an earlier era. It's a good spot for photography, which likely contributes to the large crowds.

It lies in the Middle of the market. The place is surrounded by many good restaurants, handicrafts and clothing shop. Can be reached easily. Many movies shooting took place here, From here you can see the fort. Dine at a restaurant and enjoy the scenic view along with the food.

Toorji ka Jhalra is a historical place in Jodhpur and is located very near to Ghanta Ghar (Clock Tower). It was really lovely to visit this place as it was very beautiful and peaceful, there is a little bit of crowd not overcrowded and yes this is an open place so no tickets for this place. Also the local boys jump from height directly into the water for their fun but it entertains the crowd as well. The steps here makes this place more beautiful

places.address: Makrana Mohalla, Sutharo Ka Bass Rd, Gulab Sagar, Jodhpur, Rajasthan 342001, India

places.generalDescription: Located just north of the Clock Tower in Jodhpur, the Omelette Shop is a popular roadside food joint offering a variety of delicious omelets and other fast foods. The owner, who has been working there since 1972, ensures that customers are treated to friendly service and affordable, mouthwatering dishes. Visitors can enjoy watching their omelettes being prepared while taking in the colorful market scene.

sources.snippet: Don’t miss out on having breakfast at the world famous Omelette Shop just north of the clock tower. No trip to Jodhpur would be complete without indulging in ghee-covered delicacies at Shandar Sweet Home.
sources.shortName: The Ultimate Jodhpur Instagram Guide

places.name: Omelette Shop

reviews.text: The owner said he has been working here since 1972 and now his son does most of the work. He was nice and friendly. The food was delicious, cheap and served fast - such a contrast to the overpriced touristic restaurants in town. You can watch your omelette being prepared and they have cold diet coke, unlike many restaurants. Nice spot for people-watching and photography - the market is colorful.

Worst omelette i ever had in my life. I tried their so called famous ‘Micheal Baba & ‘Masala creamy cheese' Omellette. It was burnt, not tasty at all, very bad, unhygienic. Though we couldn't complain the owner. I tried many other famous outlets of Jodhpur, all were worth trying, don't know why this omellete shop is famous. Should avoid trying this for sure.

I tried their Masala creamy omelette. It was good. The next day I tried their Michael baba omelette and Spanish omelette, to be true I didn't understand the hype for that omelette; it tasted mid, no flavours, only potatoes.
Although the owner's behaviour was friendly and polite he should think to improve the surroundings of the place and to buy new sitting arrangements.
Please note- the place doesn't open till 10:30 am

places.address: 72WF+9HP, Pal Haveli, Ghantaghar, Sri Ganganagar, Jodhpur, Rajasthan 342001, India

places.generalDescription: Rao Jodha Desert Rock Park, located in Jodhpur, Rajasthan, is a unique ecological park that offers a scenic walking trail leading to the magnificent Mehrangarh Fort. This desert park spans across 70 hectares of rocky land and was created in 2006 for the restoration of natural ecology. It features distinctive rock formations and a wide variety of native plants, including the lithophyte.

sources.snippet: Nature enthusiasts and landscape photographers will appreciate Rao Jodha Desert Rock Park for its chance to capture Jodhpur’s natural beauty in all its arid glory. Covering 70 hectares, the park hosts native flora and fauna as well as ancient rock formations that create spectacular vistas — ideal for panoramic city views as well as close-up shots of desert flowers and fauna — Rao Jodha Desert Rock Park provides endless photographic possibilities of its unique desert landscape beauty!
sources.shortName: Capturing Moments: Top Jodhpur Photo Places | by Rajwada Cab

sources.snippet: Spread over 72 hectares of land, Rao Jodha Desert Rock Park serves as one of the best places to visit in Jodhpur. The park was created in 2006 with the intent to restore the natural ecology of a large and rocky wasteland next to the Mehrangarh Fort. Inside the thriving park are an ecologically restored desert and arid land vegetation that showcase the region’s flora and fauna, adjoining the mighty fort of Jodhpur.
sources.shortName: Tourist Places to Visit in Jodhpur (2021) in 2 Days

sources.snippet: Rao Jodha Desert Rock Park was created in 2006 out of a large, rocky wasteland beside the Mehrangarh Fort. The park was built to restore the natural ecology of this neglected terrain and has become a prime tourist attraction of the city today. The rocky ravines are densely populated with the indigenous flora of the Thar desert, there are over 200 species of plants at this ecopark.
sources.shortName: 41 Best Places to visit in Jodhpur | Top Tourist Attractions

sources.snippet: Checki Now: India's Top 20 Premier Palace Hotels For The Royal Wedding. A perfect blend of stunning landscapes and natural beauty, Rao Jodha Desert Rock Park offers an adventurous backdrop and rugged terrain. With 72 hectares of land near Mehrangarh Fort, this reserve boasts desert vegetation, natural ecology, distinctive rock formations, and panoramic views of landscapes.
sources.shortName: Top 15 Pre-wedding Shoot Locations In Jodhpur

sources.snippet: Rao Jodha Desert Rock Park | #7 of 12 Best Places to visit in Jodhpur. A walking trail through the Rao Jodha Desert Rock Park will give you an insight into the plant life of the rocky trails of Rajasthan. Spread over 170-acre area, this park was built in 2006 in an effort to restore the ecology of the wetland surrounding the iconic Mehrangarh Fort.
sources.shortName: 12 Tourist Places to Visit in Jodhpur 2024: Timings, Entry Fee

sources.snippet: The Rao Jodha Desert Rock Park was developed in 2006 to restore the natural ecology of a large rocky wasteland area next to the Fort. Neglected for many years, the park was overrun by an invasive thorny shrub. After the bush was eradicated, more than 80 native species of rock-loving plants from the Thar desert were grown there.
sources.shortName: Top 13 Things to Do in Jodhpur, Rajasthan

sources.snippet: Only a short walk or rickshaw ride from the Mehrangarh Fort is Rao Jodha Desert Rock Park. This park was only opened in 2006, but holds volcanic rock that is estimated to be about 750 years old. When you enter the park, you feel like you’ve just escaped into a desert oasis miles from the hustle and bustle of the city.
sources.shortName: The Blue City, India

sources.snippet: A haven for nature enthusiasts and photographers alike, the Rao Jodha Desert Rock Park presents a unique opportunity to capture the arid beauty of the desert landscape. From unusual rock formations to indigenous flora and fauna, every corner of this ecological reserve invites exploration and photography.
sources.shortName: 10 Photo Spots at Jodhpur
25 Best Places to Visit in Jodhpur Rajasthan

places.name: Rao Jodha Desert Rock Park

reviews.text: Beautiful Park to visit and see small wildlife and natural flora, very small rock and fauna museum but very interesting. The different tracks are easy to follow and go for long walks. Very well maintained with rest areas with shade. A must visit if you are a nature lover and like walking, great views close to the blue city

I enjoy a lot the walk around the roa Jodha park. Nice and quiet place, surrounded by green. I did the green trail and took me only 35 minutes slowly walking. The yellow was only 20 minutes. You can see the wall and another nice view of the fort and blue city.
Outside they have clean toilets.

A very Unique where one can find different stones and walk a trail… In a walk there's a different bird watching, a lake and the back side of mehrangarh fort… it's worth a watch especially for nature lovers… the ticket price is 100 rs per adult

places.address: Mehrangarh Ft Rd, Kabir Nagar, Jodhpur, Rajasthan 342024, India
